channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2023100031
item.description:
Report E-2023100031

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: CORDELE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer floor and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC transferred the damaged drum from the trailer to an 85-gallon overpack for transport and disposal. The crew deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and concrete pavement. AOTC utilized hand tools to collect the spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. AOTC staged the drums onsite to be processed via R+Ls normal waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2023090749
item.description:
Report E-2023090749

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, three (3) 2-cup bottles of UN1873 were forked and released approximately two (2) cups of product released to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. Once neutralized, ER personnel collected the damaged bottles for disposal and utilized absorbent wipes to remove any remaining product. All UN1873 impacted materials were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal purposes

item.title: Report X-2023090391
item.description:
Report X-2023090391

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING IN THE LOADSIDE AREA. CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE DURING SHIPPING AND HANDLING. PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION. DescribePack: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE PLACED INTO A PLASTIC BAG AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023090717
item.description:
Report E-2023090717

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 13, 2023, one (1) 6-gallon pail of UN3265 was damaged during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the impacted pail and secured it in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The centralized the released material and collect the impacted solids with hand tools. All absorbents, debris, and PPE were contained in a separate 55-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be disposed of by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090777
item.description:
Report E-2023090777

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver didn't put out cones. Driver didn't use a bucket under the compartment connections. Driver stuck the tanks prior to hooking up the vapor. Driver laid out product hoses. Driver put the drop guns down and hooked the one product line to the drop and the compartment. Driver hooked up compartment end of other hose and forgot to hook it up at the drop gun. Driver shut down unloading and put down the diapers to to block drain and started to wipe product up. Driver reported to QT and Safety.
